alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Marshall; Panola (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 01 at 1:59PM CST until January 01 at 2:45PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Lafayette County in northwestern Mississippi... Southwestern Marshall County in northwestern Mississippi... Eastern Panola County in northwestern Mississippi... * Until 245 PM CST. * At 159 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Pope, or near Batesville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Oxford, Batesville, Holly Springs National Forest, John W Kyle State Park, Pope, Burgess, Harmontown, Laws Hill, Courtland, Abbeville, Malone, Blackwater, Teckville, Glenville, College Hill Station, College Hill, Hayes Crossing, Spraggins, Eureka Springs and Chapeltown. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for northwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
